intro: Ochrosperma monticola, commonly known as the mountain ochrosperma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a leathery texture. Ochrosperma monticola typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
